text: Hello. Does *<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/files/automatic-image-resizing-on-HubSpot-content|Automatic Image Resizing>* only happen on production domains? Eg should we expect to see it working on `<https://abcd.sandbox.hs-sites.com>` for example?
Yes only on production sites I believe
Seconded- unless it’s recently changed, automatic image resizing doesn’t occur on hs-sites domains.

Hello
I noticed this on a HubSpot website in DEBUG
```This page can be prerendered!

However, pre-rendering may be disabled for this page for the following reason(s):
- All pre-rendering is currently disabled for this portal (ENABLE_PRE_RENDER)```
where can we enable Pre Rendering?

Question related to blogs (and potentially HubDB)… We’re working with a client that has some very complex content needs for their blog(s) / resource center.  Is there a way to combine content from multiple HubSpot blog sources into a single sortable / filterable “index” page.  This index page would obviously have to be outside of the index page template for the individual blogs themselves.  We’ve not found a way with HubL so far as blog_recent_posts() is limited to 200 returned blog posts and there’s no blog_all_posts().

The client would like to have independent index pages for the different blog types + the ability to see content from all the blogs in a single location (with major visual differences between these two pages).
Hello All, is it possible to use webhook to subscribe to page view events for an account?
I know that there’s the new ability to edit listing pages in the normal page editor experience, but it doesn’t appear that you can create multiple listing pages (with different display criteria) yet.

I'm new to HubSpot development and am wondering how responsive design is achieved in HubSpot? I am used to using Bootstrap framework but I want to have some understanding of the HubSpot way and make sure I don't break the responsivness as I'm building/modifying modules.

Hello all, I am curious about how can we call an API endpoint in the template HTML/JS file, generated using HubSpot private apps? Any way to embed curl or php code in template file?

Thank you!

Hi!  Can we insert <link href="<https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Open+Sans:wght@400;600&display=swap>" rel="stylesheet"> inside <head> way before the render of multiple module css? If not, is there a way to preload fonts on HS?

We're trying to keep the font from changing on page load to avoid the "flickering" effect.

<https://go.caspio.com/ms-access-to-web-app-a-051022>
I use flexbox for responsiveness. I'm pretty sure you can't insert frameworks in HubSpot tho. but I think you can recreate it.
